title: HabitHub
step3Text: Overall, the Habit donation opens up a promising future for data-driven research. By voluntarily providing habit data, people are actively contributing to scientific knowledge and shaping progress in fields such as health, psychology and social sciences. This innovative form of data donation could not only pave the way for new discoveries, but also raise awareness of the importance of data ethics and transparency.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.text:
1. Privacy at a Glance

General Information

The following notes provide a simple overview of what happens to your personal data when you visit this website. Personal data are all data with which you can be personally identified. For detailed information on data protection, please refer to our full privacy policy below.

Data Collection on This Website

Who is responsible for data collection on this website?

Data processing on this website is carried out by the website operator. You can find their contact details in the section ‚ÄúNotice on the Responsible Entity‚Äù in this privacy policy.

How do we collect your data?

Your data is collected partly by you providing it to us. This may include data you enter into a contact form, for example.

Other data is collected automatically or after your consent when you visit the website by our IT systems. This primarily includes technical data (e.g., internet browser, operating system, or time of page access). Collection of this data takes place automatically as soon as you enter this website.

What do we use your data for?

Part of the data is collected to ensure error-free provision of the website. Other data may be used to analyze your user behavior. If contracts can be concluded or initiated via the website, the data transmitted will also be processed for contract offers, orders, or other service requests.

What rights do you have regarding your data?

You have the right at any time to obtain free information about the origin, recipients, and purpose of your stored personal data. You also have the right to request correction or deletion of this data. If you have given consent to the processing of data, you can revoke this consent at any time for the future. Furthermore, you have the right under certain circumstances to request restriction of the processing of your personal data. Moreover, you have the right to lodge a complaint with the competent supervisory authority.

For this purpose and for further questions on data protection, you can contact us at any time.

Analytics Tools and Third-Party Tools

When you visit this website, your browsing behavior may be statistically analyzed. This is done primarily with so-called analytics programs.

Detailed information on these analytics programs can be found in the full privacy policy below.

2. Hosting

We host the content of our website with the following provider:

External Hosting

This website is hosted externally. The personal data collected on this website are stored on the servers of the host(s). These may include IP addresses, contact inquiries, meta and communication data, contract data, contact data, names, website visits, and other data generated via a website.

External hosting is carried out for the purpose of fulfilling contracts with our potential and existing customers (Art. 6(1)(b) GDPR) and in the interest of a secure, fast, and efficient provision of our online offering by a professional provider (Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR). If appropriate consent has been obtained, processing is carried out solely on the basis of Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR and ¬ß 25(1) TDDDG, to the extent the consent includes the storage of cookies or device fingerprinting. Consent can be revoked at any time.

Our host(s) will process your data only to the extent necessary to fulfill their performance obligations and will follow our instructions regarding these data.

We use the following host:

Technische Universit√§t Dresden
CIDS ‚Äì Center for Interdisciplinary Digital Sciences
01062 Dresden

Phone: +49 (0)351 463-40000
Email: servicedesk@tu-dresden.de

Data Protection Officer:
Mr. Jens Syckor
01062 Dresden

Phone: +49 (0)351 463-32839
Email: informationssicherheit@tu-dresden.de

3. General Notes and Mandatory Information

Data Protection

The operators of these pages take the protection of your personal data very seriously. We treat your personal data confidentially and in accordance with legal data protection regulations and this privacy policy.

When you use this website, various personal data are collected. Personal data are data with which you can be personally identified. This privacy policy explains which data we collect and what we use them for, as well as how and for what purpose this happens.

Please note that data transmission over the Internet (e.g., by email) can have security vulnerabilities. Complete protection of data from access by third parties is not possible.

Notice on the Responsible Entity

The responsible entity for data processing on this website is:

TUD Dresden University of Technology
Faculty of Business and Economics
Research Group Digital Health
01062 Dresden

Phone: +49 351 463-37671
Email: digital-health@tu-dresden.de

The responsible entity is the natural or legal person who alone or jointly determines the purposes and means of processing personal data.

Data Retention

Unless otherwise specified, your personal data will remain with us until the purpose for data processing no longer applies. If you request deletion or revoke consent, your data will be deleted unless we have other legal grounds for retention (e.g., tax or commercial retention periods); in that case, deletion occurs after those grounds no longer apply.

Legal Bases for Processing

If you have given consent, we process your personal data on the basis of Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR. If data are necessary for contract performance or pre-contractual measures, we process on the basis of Art. 6(1)(b) GDPR. We also process data to fulfill legal obligations (Art. 6(1)(c) GDPR) or on the basis of our legitimate interest (Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR). Detailed legal bases are provided in the full privacy policy.

Recipients of Personal Data

We share personal data with external parties only when necessary for contract fulfillment, legal obligations, or legitimate interests, and always under appropriate data processing agreements.

Withdrawal of Consent

You may withdraw given consent at any time without affecting the lawfulness of processing prior to the withdrawal.

Right to Object

If processing is based on Art. 6(1)(e) or (f) GDPR, you have the right to object at any time for reasons arising from your particular situation. If data are processed for direct marketing, you may object at any time (Art. 21 GDPR).

Complaint to Supervisory Authority

In case of GDPR violations, you have the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority in your Member State of residence or work.

Data Portability

You have the right to receive data you provided in a structured, machine-readable format and to request direct transmission to another controller, where technically feasible.

Access, Rectification, Erasure

You have the right to obtain free information about your stored personal data and to request correction or deletion at any time.

Restriction of Processing

  • If you contest the accuracy of your data, processing may be restricted during verification.
  • If processing is unlawful, you can request restriction instead of erasure.
  • If we no longer need your data but you need them for legal claims, you can request restriction.
  • If you object under Art. 21(1) GDPR, processing may be restricted while interests are balanced.

SSL/TLS Encryption

This site uses SSL/TLS to protect the transmission of confidential information. You can recognize an encrypted connection by ‚Äúhttps://‚Äù and the lock icon in your browser.

4. Data Collection on This Website

Cookies

Our site uses ‚Äúcookies,‚Äù small data files that are stored on your device to enable analysis of website use. Session cookies are deleted after your visit; persistent cookies remain until you delete them.

Cookies can be first-party or third-party; they are used for necessary technical functions, analytics, or advertising. Necessary cookies are based on Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR; other cookies require your consent (Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR and ¬ß 25(1) TDDDG) and can be withdrawn at any time.

You can configure your browser to inform about or block cookies; disabling cookies may limit site functionality.

Contact Form

If you send inquiries via the contact form, your data (including contact details) will be stored to process your request. Data are processed on the basis of Art. 6(1)(b) or (f) GDPR, or your consent (Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR). You can request deletion or withdraw consent at any time.

Inquiries via Email, Phone, Fax

If you contact us by email, phone, or fax, your inquiry and personal data will be stored and processed to handle your request. Data processing is based on Art. 6(1)(b), (f), or (a) GDPR. You can request deletion or withdraw consent at any time.

5. Plugins and Tools

Google Fonts

This site uses Google Fonts for uniform font display. Your browser connects to Google servers to fetch the fonts, which may log your IP address. Use is based on Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR or, with consent, Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR and ¬ß 25(1) TDDDG. Consent can be withdrawn at any time.

If your browser does not support Google Fonts, a standard font is used.

More information: Google Fonts FAQ and Google Privacy Policy.

Google reCAPTCHA

We use Google reCAPTCHA to verify that form submissions are made by humans. Google analyzes user behavior (e.g., IP address, mouse movements) in the background and may store cookies. Use is based on Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR or, with consent, Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR and ¬ß 25(1) TDDDG. Consent can be withdrawn at any time.

More information: Google Privacy and Google Terms.

Source: e-recht24.de

accessibility.title: Accessibility Statement
accessibility.text:
The Research Group Digital Health is committed to making its websites and mobile applications accessible, in accordance with the Accessible Websites Act (BfWebG) and the Accessible Information Technology Ordinance (BITV 2.0), implementing EU Directive 2016/2102.

Preparation of this Accessibility Statement

This statement was prepared on April 8, 2025 and last updated on April 8, 2025. The last review of this web presence by means of self-assessment was carried out on April 8, 2025.
The basis for preparing this statement is a self-assessment of the website's compliance with the requirements of the BfWebG in accordance with BITV 2.0.

Compliance Status with the Requirements of BITV

This web presence was published before April 8, 2025 and does not yet fully meet the current state of accessibility. We are continuously working on the further development of this web presence and are striving to reduce barriers in the process.

Non-accessible Content

  • Alternative texts for images and graphic elements are not fully available.
  • ARIA attributes for orientation within elements are not fully available.
  • Keyboard accessibility is not fully available for the following elements/contents: Labels for context and behavior.
  • The position of the keyboard focus is not clearly visible.
  • Words and sections in other languages are not marked.
  • There is no summary page in forms for subsequent review or correction of input. The data is transmitted directly.
  • On home and overview pages, certain elements cannot be skipped because headings are missing.

Feedback and Contact Information

If you notice any shortcomings regarding accessible design, please contact us at:

Email: digital-health@tu-dresden.de
Phone: +49 351 463-37671

Enforcement Procedure

If you are not satisfied with the handling of your feedback, you can contact the enforcement body of the Free State of Saxony:

Office of the Commissioner of the Saxon State Government for the Affairs of Persons with Disabilities
Albertstra√üe 10
01097 Dresden

Mailing address: Archivstra√üe 1, 01097 Dresden
Email: info.behindertenbeauftragter@sk.sachsen.de
Phone: +49 351 564-12161
Internet: https://www.inklusion.sachsen.de

imprint.text:

Disclaimer

The contents of this website have been created with the greatest possible care. However, we cannot guarantee the accuracy, completeness, or timeliness of the information provided.

External Links

This website contains links to external third-party websites. We have no influence over the content of these sites. The respective provider or operator is responsible for the content of the linked sites.

Further Information

For further information, please refer to the imprint of TU Dresden.

text:
Dear habit contributor,
As you‚Äôre likely aware, a habit establishes a connection between a behavior and a context in which the behavior is consistently performed. Take, for instance, the behavior of running 5 kilometers. This behavior can be associated with the context of waking up in the morning on a weekend. In this scenario, the context category time (weekend mornings) and the context category related behavior (waking up in the morning) is combined into a comprehensive context. We are interested in exploring the contexts you assign to your behaviors to make it your habit. By sharing your habits with us, you contribute to a greater understanding of how specific contexts can reinforce behaviors. Your insights will be invaluable in helping other craft strong, personalized habits.
step1: Enter your habit as a sentence.
step2: Mark the parts of your sentence and assign the context or situation listed below to each part.
step3: Confirm your habit you want to donate by pressing "Donate".
example1: Example: If I enter the kitchen and see a fruit basket, I am taking an apple and eat it.
example2: <h5>Placeholder: I drink a glass of water before bedtime.<h5>
demo_text: The information you provide will help us to gain valuable insights. In order to better classify the data and improve the research results, we would be pleased if you could provide the information below. Participation is voluntary and anonymous. The information will be treated confidentially. </br> Please take a moment to fill in the fields below:
other_way: Other (e.g. home office with occasional on-site appointments)
separate_partner_child: Living separately, but in partnership with child/children
partner_healthy: My partner is very health-conscious and regularly physically active.
partner_moderate_healthy: My partner is moderately health-conscious and occasionally physically active.
partner_supportive: My partner supports my efforts to lead a healthy lifestyle.
partner_less_healthy: My partner is not very health-conscious and is rarely physically active.
partner_inactive: My partner prefers a predominantly inactive lifestyle and shows little interest in health aspects.
pet_regular: I have a pet that I regularly exercise/walk with.
pet_more_activity: I have pets that encourage me to be more active in everyday life.
pet_no_impact: I have pets that have no effect on my physical activity.
no_pet: I do not have any pets.
slogan: You brought YOUR habit on the way to be become a common good.
thanks: üéâ Thank you for YOUR donation and for YOUR contribution!

donateErrors.emptyFieldError: The text field must not be empty!
donateErrors.emptyBehaviorError: Please mark a behavior in the text before submitting.
donateErrors.noContextError: Please confirm that you are not a robot.

habitStrengthSlider.title: How much do you want to stop or keep this habit?

form_descriptions.sex: Choose the gender you identify with the most.
form_descriptions.origin: Select the country you are from.
form_descriptions.graduation: Select the highest level you have completed.
form_descriptions.age: Type in your current age in years.
form_descriptions.weight: Select the weight category that best describes you.
form_descriptions.occupation: Select the option that best describes your current professional situation.
form_descriptions.working_hours: Select the option that best describes your working hours.
form_descriptions.way_to_work: Select the option that best describes your way to work.
form_descriptions.private_context: Select the option that best describes your current family situation.
form_descriptions.available_time: Select the option that best describes how much time you have available for your habits.
form_descriptions.relationship_context: Select the option that best describes your partner's attitude towards health and physical activity.
form_descriptions.pets: Select the option that best describes your relationship with pets and their influence on your physical activity.

disclaimer.text:
Welcome!

This site is intended for users aged 18 and over. We use a small cookie to store your confirmation and improve your experience.

By clicking ‚ÄúEnter Website‚Äù, you confirm that you are over 18 and accept our privacy policy.
